FuncDef:
The llayer3-subscriber ipv4 vpn-instance switch enable command enables dynamic VPN instance switching for Layer 3 static users.
The undo layer3-subscriber ipv4 vpn-instance switch enable command disables dynamic VPN instance switching for Layer 3 static users.
By default, dynamic VPN instance switching is not enabled for Layer 3 static users.
CLIs: layer3-subscriber ipv4 vpn-instance switch enable [ export host-route ]
undo layer3-subscriber ipv4 vpn-instance switch enable [ export host-route ]
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow the system to use the VPN instance delivered by the RADIUS server or through a CoA message for Layer 3 static users, run the layer3-subscriber vpn-instance switch enable command.
After this command is run, the HW-VPN-Instance attribute delivered through a RADIUS authentication response packet or CoA message is applied to Layer 3 static users. If export host-route is configured, routes will be advertised after the VPN instance is changed for Layer 3 static users.
Precautions
The layer3-subscriber vpn-instance switch enable command takes effect only for subsequent Layer 3 static users.
